Vinh Long Specialty: Discover The Essence Of Southern Vietnamese Cuisine
What To Eat - Where To Stay - What To Do - Vinh Long Countryside

ğŸš£â€ Vinh Long has long been known as an ideal destination in the Mekong Delta, where visitors can take boat tours, explore the local river culture, and participate in unique entertainment activities. When visiting Vinh Long, travelers have the opportunity to admire lush fruit orchards, watch the sunset by the gentle Tien River, have fun at eco-tourism sites, or visit ancient and majestic temples.
ğŸ“Œ Below, I will share useful information to help you prepare for your upcoming trip to Vinh Long!

ğŸŒ¾ Vinh Long is a fertile land with 90% of its land used for rice cultivation. Additionally, every year, the people of Vinh Long harvest hundreds of thousands of tons of various fruits such as pomelo, longan, coconut, oranges, etc.
ğŸ•ï¸ Vinh Long has great potential for tourism development, including eco-tourism, cultural tourism, spiritual tourism, and commerce.
â³WHEN IS THE BEST TIME TO VISIT VINH LONG?

â˜€ï¸ Vinh Long has a tropical monsoon climate, warm throughout the year with a pleasant atmosphere, and an average annual temperature of 27Â°C. The rainy season usually lasts from April to November, while the dry season is from May to October. Therefore, visitors can explore Vinh Long at any time of the year.

ğŸŒ³ However, the rainy season is also the time when fruit orchards in Vinh Long are at their peak. Visitors can enjoy delicious fresh fruits while experiencing the cool and refreshing countryside atmosphere.
ğŸ¨ ACCOMMODATION OPTIONS IN VINH LONG

ğŸ¡ Vinh Long offers various types of accommodation, including "homestays" where visitors can stay with local families. This type of lodging provides a unique opportunity to experience local life, be close to nature, and gain a deeper understanding of the culture and daily activities of Vinh Longâ€™s people.

ğŸŒ¿ Alternatively, visitors can choose to stay in guesthouses, hotels, or even go camping. Some recommended hotels in Vinh Long include Hoang Hao Hotel, Phuong Hoang Hotel, Saigon - Vinh Long Hotel, Cuu Long Hotel, Ngu Long Hotel, Tai Nguyen Hotel, and Khanh Quynh Hotel.
FASCINATING TOURIST ATTRACTIONS IN VINH LONG
Truong Huy Tourist Area: Located in Truong An Commune...
An Binh Islet: A famous eco-tourism fruit garden...
Vinh Sang Ecotourism Area: A place to explore the Southern garden...
Mang Thit Pottery Village: One of the largest traditional brick and pottery-making areas in the Mekong Delta. Be sure to visit Mang Thit Pottery Village when you come to Vinh Long!

Tra On Floating Market: Located in Tra On District, Vinh Long Province, about 250 meters from Tra On Estuary, Tra On Floating Market is situated on the lower section of the Hau River, stretching over 300 meters. It serves as a wholesale market where agricultural products, fruits, and various goods are distributed in bulk.
Your journey to Vinh Long will be truly complete if you explore the famous specialties of this land.

Tra On Sweet Orange is a famous specialty of Vinh Long, often bought by tourists as a gift. This orange variety has a thin peel, a mildly sweet taste, juicy and fragrant segments. In Vinh Long, Tra On Sweet Orange is mainly grown in Tra On Town and Tam Binh.
Thanh Tra Fruit is commonly grown in Vinh Long. The sour variety is often mixed with sugar to make a refreshing drink on hot days, while the sweet variety can be eaten directly.

Giant Gourami fish is sold in seafood markets and Tra On floating market, a specialty of the Mekong Delta. There are many ways to prepare this fish, but the crispy fried version is the most memorable. It is best enjoyed with rice paper, fresh herbs, and fermented fish sauce.
Grilled field rat is a rustic dish enjoyed by farmers in Vinh Long. These rats live in rice fields, feeding on grains, making their meat naturally sweet, rich in flavor, and delicious when grilled.
